Ini yang Bikin Tol Laut Belum Efektif Pangkas Harga Barang
01 Nov 2019, 11:58 by Herdi Alif Alhikam


Foto: Mardi Rahmat

Jakarta - Presiden Joko Widodo mengeluhkan adanya monopoli pada tol laut. Karena hal tersebut, tujuan memangkas harga barang yang mahal di daerah terpencil pun tidak terlaksana dengan baik.Menurut Direktur Lalu Lintas dan Angkutan Laut Ditjen Perhubungan Laut Kemenhub Wisnu Handoko harga mahal bukan hanya karena adanya monopoli saja. Beberapa faktor lain pun berkontribusi membuat harga barang masih mahal.Salah satunya adalah adanya Koperasi Tenaga Kerja Bongkar Muat (TKBM) yang hanya ada satu di setiap pelabuhan membuat perusahaan pelayaran tidak punya pilihan. Akhirnya mereka harus mengeluarkan berapapun biaya yang ditawarkan oleh koperasi meskipun mahal."Hanya ada Koperasi TKBM yang melayani satu pelabuhan. Selama ini kita selalu kritisi di pelabuhan hanya ada satu TKBM, karena tak ada kompetisi akhirnya biaya menjadi tinggi," ucap Wisnu di kantornya, Jumat (1/11/2019).Bahkan, Wisnu menyebut terkadang koperasi-koperasi ini suka meminta biaya tambahan. "TKBM minta biaya tambahan bisa di luar cargo handling dan sebagainya hingga Rp 1juta," sebutnya.Selanjutnya, terkadang dari penerima barang alias consignee masih belum memberikan harga yang murah saat barang sudah sampai lokasi tujuan. Padahal pengiriman barang telah disubsidi oleh pemerintah."Consignee yang sudah dapat barang banyak seharusnya jual harga murah karena sudah disubsidi pengirimannya. Masalahnya, consignee-consignee yang borong kami rasa dia tidak jual dengan harga rendah dari pasar," ungkap Wisnu.Simak Video "Jokowi Sebut Ada Pihak Swasta Nakal Main-main di Tol Laut"[Gambas:Video 20detik](zlf/zlf)

This is what makes the Sea Toll Road Not Effectively Cut Price of Goods
Nov 01 2019, 11:58 by Herdi Alif Alhikam


Photo: Mardi Rahmat

Jakarta - President Joko Widodo complained about the monopoly on the sea highway. Because of this, the aim of cutting the price of expensive goods in remote areas was not well implemented. According to the Director of Sea Transportation and Sea Transportation at the Transportation Ministry of Transportation, Wisnu Handoko, the high price was not only due to monopolies. Several other factors also contribute to making the price of goods still expensive. One of them is the existence of the Cooperative Unloading Workers (TKBM) which there is only one in each port to make shipping companies have no choice. Finally, they have to pay whatever costs are offered by cooperatives even though they are expensive. "There are only TKBM cooperatives that serve one port. So far, we have always criticized that there is only one TKBM in the port, because there is no competition, eventually the costs are high," Wisnu said in his office, Friday (1/11/2019). In fact, Wisnu said that sometimes these cooperatives like to ask for additional fees. "TKBM can ask for additional costs beyond cargo handling and so forth up to Rp. 1 million," he said. Furthermore, sometimes the recipient of goods alias consignee still does not provide a cheap price when the goods have arrived at the destination location. Even though the delivery of goods has been subsidized by the government. "Consignees who have obtained a lot of goods should sell cheap prices because they have subsidized shipping. The problem is, the consignees who are interested in buying we feel he does not sell at low prices from the market," said Wisnu.
